author: pipermerriam
content: <@!425615769280315392> that piece about being able to do probabilistic linkage between an IP address and state access (and to a lesser extent transaction origin) does seem more problematic now that I'm looking closer at it.  It would be nice if we could figure out a way to prevent this.  Data poisoning, relaying, plausible deniablity, something

author: jason.carver
content: First thought is randomly relaying 1/2 or 1/4 of all inbound requests. Then a smart spy would watch the full proof path and check if you're requesting a single node (probably a relay) or the full path (probably a "true" request).

author: jason.carver
content: There are potentially incentive-based versions (pay for privacy), but let's keep that off the table until we exhaust all other options
